statements.name: PROC FEDSQL
statements.description: Specifies that the subsequent input is FedSQL language statements.

arguments.name: _METHOD
arguments.description: prints a brief text description of the FedSQL query plan.

arguments.name: _POSTOPTPLAN
arguments.description: prints an XML tree illustrating the FedSQL query plan.

arguments.name: ANSIMODE
arguments.description: specifies that nonexistent values in CHAR and DOUBLE columns are processed as ANSI SQL null values.

arguments.name: AUTOCOMMIT
arguments.description: for use with DBMS that support transactions only, specifies whether updates are automatically saved to a table after a default number of rows are updated, or whether rollback is available.

arguments.name: NOAUTOCOMMIT
arguments.description: for use with DBMS that support transactions only, specifies whether updates are automatically saved to a table after a default number of rows are updated, or whether rollback is available.

arguments.name: CNTL=
arguments.description: specifies optional control instructions for FedSQL query planning and query execution in CAS.

arguments.name: DISABLEPASSTHROUGH
arguments.description: disables implicit FedSQL pass-through in CAS.

arguments.name: DYNAMICCARDINALITY
arguments.description: instructs the FedSQL query planner to perform cardinality estimations before selecting a query plan.

arguments.name: OPTIMIZEVARBINARYPRECISION
arguments.description: optimizes VARBINARY precision by using a precision that is appropriate to the actual data, instead of the precision declared for the VARBINARY columns.

arguments.name: OPTIMIZEVARCHARPRECISION
arguments.description: optimizes VARCHAR precision by using a precision that is appropriate to the actual data, instead of the precision declared for the VARCHAR columns.

arguments.name: PRESERVEJOINORDER
arguments.description: joins tables in the specified order instead of an order chosen by the FedSQL query optimizer.

arguments.name: REQUIREFULLPASSTHROUGH
arguments.description: stops processing the FedSQL request when implicit pass-through of the full query cannot be achieved.

arguments.name: SHOWSTAGES
arguments.description: writes query execution details to the SAS log.

arguments.name: ERRORSTOP
arguments.description: specifies whether the procedure stops executing if it encounters an error.

arguments.name: NOERRORSTOP
arguments.description: specifies whether the procedure stops executing if it encounters an error.

arguments.name: EXEC
arguments.description: specifies whether a statement should be executed after its syntax is checked for accuracy.

arguments.name: NOEXEC
arguments.description: specifies whether a statement should be executed after its syntax is checked for accuracy.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether to use the column label or the column name as the column heading.

arguments.name: NOLABEL
arguments.description: specifies whether to use the column label or the column name as the column heading.

arguments.name: LIBS=
arguments.description: specifies one or more librefs that have previously been assigned to a SAS library.

arguments.name: MEMSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies a limit for the amount of memory that is used for an underlying query (such as a SELECT statement), so that allocated memory is available to support other PROC FEDSQL operations.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses the normal display of results.

arguments.name: NUMBER
arguments.description: specifies to include a column named Row, which is the row (observation) number of the data as the rows are retrieved.

arguments.name: SESSREF=
arguments.description: specifies to run the FedSQL statements in a CAS session. The CAS session is identified by its session name.

arguments.name: SESSUUID=
arguments.description: specifies to run the FedSQL statements in a CAS session. The CAS session is identified by its universally unique identifier (UUID).

arguments.name: STIMER
arguments.description: specifies to write a subset of system performance statistics, such as time-elapsed statistics, to the SAS log.

arguments.name: XCODE=
arguments.description: controls the behavior of the SAS session when an NLS transcoding failure occurs.

arguments.name: ERROR
arguments.description: specifies that a run-time error occurs, which causes row processing to halt. An error message is written to the SAS log. This is the default behavior.

arguments.name: WARNING
arguments.description: specifies that the incompatible character is set to a substitution character. A warning message is written to the SAS log.

arguments.name: IGNORE
arguments.description: specifies that the incompatible character is set to a substitution character. No messages are written to the SAS log.

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Stops the execution of the FEDSQL procedure.
